arts.ttl: Hull City boss Ruben Selles explains why he was not in the dugout for huge Oxford United win
arts.sum: Ruben Selles admits he must learn his lesson, having been forced to watch Hull City's 2-1 comeback win against Oxford United from the stands after being handed a touchline ban. Selles had regular conversations with coach Toby Loveland, who relayed messages to the likes of James Oliver Pearce, Andy Dawson and goalkeeping coach Erbil Bozkurt in the technical area, including the triple change which turned the game back in City's favour.

arts.ttl: Ruben Selles addresses Gustavo Puerta red card in Hull City's priceless win over Oxford United
arts.sum: It was a big game to play with the 10 men for such a long time, but I still think that if we were playing 11 against 11, we would probably be talking about a little bit more right now. "We started well in the first half, but we started to miss a couple of passes; they came back into the game and then in the second half, I think when we were having a good time, they scored from that corner, but then the team go through that goal, score the first one, score the second one and were able to protect.

arts.ttl: Gary Rowett: ‘Probably the harshest I’ve been with the players’
arts.sum: GARY Rowett admitted he was the harshest he has been with his Oxford United players after watching them throw away a lead inside 10 minutes at Hull City.

arts.ttl: Hull hit back with swift turnaround to beat Oxford
arts.sum: Hull moved above Oxford in the Sky Bet Championship table with a crucial 2-1 win at the MKM Stadium.

arts.ttl: Hull City stage stunning comeback to beat Oxford United and boost survival hopes
arts.sum: Selles was forced into one change with Joao Pedro missing the first of three games after his sending off at Bristol City on Saturday, with Matt Crooks coming back into the starting XI, with the head coach deploying the ex-Middlesbrough man as the striker, and instead keeping Joe Gelhardt in the free role behind Crooks, and ex-Oxford man Kyle Joseph and Abu Kamara on either side. The Tigers decent start fizzled out and gradually, Gary Rowett's men came back into it and created their first moment of danger from a silly free-kick given away outside the box, and from that, Matt Phillips' teasing delivery was headed just wide by Elliott Moore to give the hosts a warning.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings as Charlie Hughes shines in come from behind win over Oxford United
arts.sum: Joe Gelhardt and Gustavo Puerta helped Hull City recover from a goal down to beat Oxford United 2-1 and boost their Championship survival quest. Oxford hit the front after 66 minutes when Michal Helik thumped in a terrific volley, but City came back and scored two quick-fire goals through Joe Gelhardt and a Jamie Cumming own goal, to lift the roof off the MKM Stadium.

arts.ttl: Jamie Cumming error gives Hull victory against relegation rivals Oxford
arts.sum: Michal Helik had given the visitors the lead.

arts.ttl: Oxford United boss Gary Rowett makes Hull City claim ahead of key MKM Stadium battle
arts.sum: It has to be because whether you’re playing Norwich away or Hull away, or Watford at home, you have an opponent desperate to try and win the game," Rowett told the Oxford Mail . Gary Rowett believes Hull City have improved significantly under Ruben Selles as he looks to secure a big away win for his Oxford United on Wednesday night.

arts.ttl: Hull City predicted starting XI to face Oxford United as Tigers face Joao Pedro dilemma
arts.sum: In the past two games, Joseph has played off the left with Kamara on the right and Gelhardt in a more central free role, which has been really effective for City, and pushing Joseph through the middle would lose that pressing energy he provides. Pedro's enforced absence will hand the chance to another member of Selles' attacking unit, and it could well see Matt Crooks return to the starting XI, while Kasey Palmer and Mason Burstow are both pushing for recalls.

arts.ttl: ‘Serious foul play’ – Joao Pedro red card for Hull City against Bristol City assessed by former referee
arts.sum: Hull City attacker Joao Pedro’s red card against Bristol City was the right decision, former referee Chris Foy… The post ‘Serious foul play’ – Joao Pedro red card for Hull City against Bristol City assessed by former referee appeared first on The72 - Football League News.
